comments:
Host : Windows XP SP2 Eng
Target : Windows 2003 R2 SP2 Eng
DeviceKit : build 20071017
Reader : Intermec BRI
***********************************************************
The GPIO profile test succeeded, but found exceptions on target system during the test. I did not find such error on single local GPIO test on the same reader.

org.osgi.framework.InvalidSyntaxException: Missing '(' at character 0
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FilterImpl$Parser.parse_filter(FilterImpl.java:1433)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FilterImpl$Parser.parse(FilterImpl.java:1419)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FilterImpl.<init>(FilterImpl.java:148)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.createFilter(BundleContextImpl.java:1301)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.device.Container.createFilter(Container.java:369)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.gpio.profile.GpioProfile.updateFilter(GpioProfile.java:1365)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.gpio.profile.GpioProfile.handleMethodOutputExpression(GpioProfile.java:1143)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.gpio.profile.GpioProfile.handleMethodOutput1Expression(GpioProfile.java:1190)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:64)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:615)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.measurement.MethodMeasurement.callMethod(MethodMeasurement.java:104)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.measurement.MethodMeasurement.executeWrite(MethodMeasurement.java:125)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.device.NotificationController.process(NotificationController.java:552)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.device.NotificationController.run(NotificationController.java:679)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:799)
[ERROR] 2007-11-06 16:32:03.515 - Esc0001: Error has occurred.
	object:        R1/Gpio/Output1Expression
	class:         org.eclipse.soda.dk.measurement.MethodMeasurement
	system:        {awt.toolkit=sun.awt.windows.WToolkit,com.ibm.cpu.endian=little,com.ibm.oti.configuration=scar,com.ibm.oti.jcl.build=20060906_1248,com.ibm.oti.vm.bootstrap.library.path=C:\IBM\Java50\jre\bin,com.ibm.oti.vm.library.version=23,com.ibm.util.extralibs.properties=,com.ibm.vm.bitmode=32,eclipse.commands=-dev
file:D:/DeviceKit/workspace/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.core/intermec.bri.gpio.profile.test.factory (1)/dev.properties

This exception occurs when testing the GPIO profile locally and remotely.

The test case where this happens is one in which we purposely set an invalid measurement for the GPIO profile.
We set the measurement to be 'i1=true', which is an invalid measurement. A valid measurement would be '(i1=true)'.
Note that the exception is correct since the measurement should start with a '('.
After we set the invalid measurement, we test that we get an error message back, which we do, so the test passes.

In summary, since we are setting an incorrect measurement and testing that an error is generated, an exception is to be expected in this case.

If you would like to view the test case, it is located in GpioProfileMeasurementErrorsTestCase.java in the project org.eclipse.soda.dk.gpio.profile.test.agent.
